description: The story humorously unfolds why a math book is 'sad', set in a classroom context.
title: Problems Galore
n_1: Max, puzzled by the complexity of problems in his math book, shares his dilemma with Emma.
n_2: They closely inspect the numerous problems filling the pages.
n_3: Max humorously empathizes with the 'sad' math book.
n_4: Their shared laughter creates a light-hearted moment in the classroom.
c1_1: Can you believe this? It's just problem after problem!
c1_2: Look at this one, and this one too!
c1_3: I get why this book is so sad now. It's got too many problems!
c2_3: Haha, that's a good one, Max!
c1_4: Maybe we can solve a few and make it happier?
c2_4: Let's do it! One problem at a time!
